item.title: All Caitlyn Skins In League Of Legends, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Caitlyn's skins vary in quality, with some lacking significant changes and visuals.
  • Skins like Officer and Headhunter Caitlyn have minor VFX and SFX changes.
  • Legendary skins like Pulsefire and Battle Academia Caitlyn stand out for their unique themes and stunning effects.

Caitlyn is one of the most popular champions in League of Legends , thanks to her extensive number of skins and heavy involvement in the iconic Netflix show Arcane . The Sheriff of Piltover is best known for being an early-game bot lane bully who dominates opponents with her superior range.

Caitlyn has received 17 skins in the 13 years that she has been part of League of Legends . With a wide variety of cosmetics to choose from, it is expected that some of her skins will stand out from the rest.

Prestige variants of Arcade and Arcane Commander will not be ranked in this list. This list also contains mild spoilers for season two of Arcane .

16 Resistance Caitlyn

Classic Skin

  • Price : 520 RP
  • Release date : January 04, 2011
  • Available in the store

Resistance Caitlyn is one of the two cheapest skins players can buy for the Sheriff of Piltover. Due to its low price, it is undeniably the worst skin for her as it adds nothing new to her VFX and SFX.

The only change comes in the form of a different attire and gun, which isn't anything extraordinary. There is not a lot to say about this skin as it is little more than a slightly altered version of her default outfit.

15 Sheriff Caitlyn

Classic Skin

  • Price : 520 RP
  • Release date : January 04, 2011
  • Legacy Vault cosmetic

Sheriff Caitlyn also comes in at a price of 520 RP, which means there are no unique audio or visual effects. The main reason it ranks higher than Resistance is that the theme of this skin suits Caitlyn quite well.

Apart from this, there isn't anything noteworthy to talk about with this skin, which has clearly not stood the test of time when it comes to the character's overall design.

14 Arctic Warfare Caitlyn

Deluxe Skin

  • Price : 750 RP
  • Release date : December 29, 2011
  • Available in the store

Arctic Warfare is the only 750RP skin Caitlyn has in League of Legends . Similar to the previous two entries, this skin doesn't boast any new visual and sound effects for her abilities.

However, the auto attacks feel a bit smoother with this skin thanks to its well-designed gun. This winter-themed outfit is also a great look for Caitlyn. Unfortunately, this skin can't rank any higher than this spot as it doesn't have much else apart from said features.

13 Officer Caitlyn

Standard Skin

  • Price : 975 RP
  • Release date : October 05, 2011
  • Available in the store

Officer Caitlyn is the first entry on this list with slightly different SFX and VFX. These changes are very minimal, such as her bullets changing color and a doughnut replacing a cupcake in her traps.

This is one of Caitlyn's most on-brand skins in League of Legends as it captures her role as a keeper of law brilliantly. This skin could have definitely ranked higher if it had a few more unique things going for it.

12 Safari Caitlyn

Standard Skin

  • Price : 975 RP
  • Release date : May 10, 2011
  • Legacy Vault cosmetic

Safari is an interesting yet welcome addition to the plethora of skins Caitlyn has. It is a theme that matches Caitlyn pretty well considering she is a sharpshooter. The skin itself has a couple of changes that make it stand out just a tiny bit.

Most of the abilities now have a green and yellow color palette to go with the skin's safari theme. It is a smooth skin for a cheap price, and is often used by some of the most terrifying Caitlyn mains that players might encounter in solo queue.

11 Headhunter Caitlyn

Standard Skin

  • Price : 975 RP
  • Release date : September 03, 2014
  • Available in the store

Headhunter is one of Caitlyn's heaviest-hitting skins in terms of SFX and VFX. The bright red color added to all of her abilities combined with a menacing gun makes Caitlyn feel like a lethal weapon.

However, the sound effects are quite hit-and-miss and can feel clunky at times. The metallic feel of this skin makes it divisive in terms of its popularity. Nonetheless, it is a solid Caitlyn skin for players who are on a budget.

10 Lunar Wraith Caitlyn

Epic Skin

  • Price : 1350 RP
  • Release date : 27 January, 2016
  • Legacy Vault cosmetic

Lunar Wraith has the unfortunate honor of being Caitlyn's worst epic skin. This is not a knock on Lunar Wraith, as it is a genuinely decent skin for its price. It sports Caitlyn in a skin universe that is not akin to her, which is a nice change in tone.

The skin also has decent audio and visual effects. However, it just falls flat compared to the rest of her epic skins.

9 Arcane Caitlyn

Standard Skin

  • Price : 975 RP
  • Release date : November 22, 2021
  • Only available through chests

The first Arcane-themed skin for Caitlyn, released before the conclusion of Season 1 of the Netflix series, is one of her smoothest skins and stands out among the skins that do not have major VFX and SFX changes.

Caitlyn's simple outfit, crisp auto-attacks, and lightweight feel make this skin a popular choice for a lot of players. The only drawback is that it can be acquired purely through chests and cannot be bought from the store.

8 Arcade Caitlyn

Epic Skin

  • Price : 1350 RP
  • Release date : June 28, 2019
  • Available in the store

Arcade Caitlyn is a colorful skin with 8-bit sound effects and visuals on her abilities. This fits her theme as an ace sniper very well in this particular skin universe. The primary problem with this skin is the gun and the traps.

The sound effects and figure of the gun lessen the impact of her auto-attacks, and make it feel a bit wonky, while most of her other skins have clean and crisp auto-attacks. The sound effects can also get a bit annoying at times. The traps on this skin are much more visible, which makes it a detriment in very rare scenarios. Overall, it is a decent skin with catchy VFX that can appeal to gamers who love the arcade theme.

7 Pool Party Caitlyn

Epic Skin

  • Price : 1350 RP
  • Release date : August 02, 2019
  • Available in the store

Pool Party is one of the most popular skin universes in League of Legends, and Caitlyn's skin is no exception. It is a fundamentally great skin with watery sound effects on her abilities that are executed to perfection.

It is also a nice change of character for Caitlyn, as she is often featured in skin universes where she has to maintain her stoic and focused personality. The relaxed vibe of Pool Party, paired with the wonderful chromas, SFX, and VFX, makes it a great option for players looking to grab a 1350RP Caitlyn skin.

6 Arcane Commander Caitlyn

Epic Skin

  • Price : 1350 RP
  • Release date : November 20, 2024
  • Available in the store

Arcane Commander Caitlyn is a better and meaner version of the original skin. The Arcane skin, based on Season 1, depicts Caitlyn before the tragic demise of her mother thanks to Jinx. This skin captures the hardened and vengeful persona of Season 2 Caitlyn in a great way.

The Hextech-infused gun and the powerful sound effects really drive home the fact that this version of Caitlyn means business. The only thing that could have been improved is a more appealing color scheme.

5 Heartthrob Caitlyn

Epic Skin

  • Price : 1350 RP
  • Release date : February 10, 2023
  • Available in the store

Heartthrob Caitlyn is the direct counterpart to Heartache Vi. This skin universe is one of Vi's best skins and the same can be said for Caitlyn.

The sound effects have a unique charm and power to them. It elegantly mixes the romantic vibe of the skin while not forsaking the strong audio design. This is one of Caitlyn's most underrated skins and rightfully deserves a spot in the top five.

4 Snow Moon Caitlyn

Epic Skin

  • Price : 1350 RP
  • Release date : June 23, 2022
  • Available in the store

Snow Moon is one of Caitlyn's latest skins, and it quickly rose in popularity for its smooth visual and sound effects. Using this skin feels like cutting through butter with a hot knife. The audio is also not too distracting while maintaining the elegance and powerful feel of the gun.

The reason why it doesn't break into the top three is that it can feel a bit too bland at times. It does a great job, but it doesn't have the defining factor to truly stand out as one of Caitlyn's very best.

3 DRX Caitlyn

Epic Skin

  • Price : 1350 RP
  • Release date : June 01, 2023
  • Legacy Vault cosmetic

DRX Caitlyn is probably the skin with the most emotional weight behind it. This skin was made in honor of legendary ADC Kim "Deft" Hyuk-kyu winning the 2022 Worlds Championship with DRX in one of the most unexpected tournament runs in the history of the event.

The skin itself has an outstanding feel to it. The blue and silver color palette works superbly with Caitlyn, and the sound effects are absolute music to listen to. The recall, which exemplifies Deft's 10-year-long journey filled with hardships to win the biggest title of his career, is the cherry on top which makes this skin one of a kind.

2 Battle Academia Caitlyn

Legendary Skin

  • Price : 1820 RP
  • Release date : March 18, 2021
  • Available in the store

Battle Academia Caitlyn reimagines Caitlyn as a snobbish and arrogant student who is simply the best at whatever she does. While she doesn't get to be the very best on this list, this skin is undeniably a masterpiece.

From taking the first steps at the start of the match to the anime-esque border while using her ultimate, this skin is loaded with content to experience. The VFX and SFX are splendid, and her interactions with other Battle Academia champions are hilarious too.

1 Pulsefire Caitlyn

Legendary Skin

  • Price : 1820 RP
  • Release date : May 24, 2017
  • Available in the store

Despite Battle Academia being a very popular skin, the timeless feel of Pulsefire Caitlyn will never wane. The Piltovan Sheriff has now become a time-traveling law enforcer with an imposing gun that is simply Caitlyn's best out of all of her skins.

The futuristic vibe and sound effects fit Caitlyn to a tee. Every auto-attack with this skin feels powerful, and the headshot genuinely sounds devastating, just like how her unique voice lines allude to. While it doesn't have the same amount of detail and hidden gems as Battle Academia, it is one of the smoothest and most iconic skins in the game.

item.title: Marvel Rivals: Best PC Settings for High FPS
item.description:
For those who grew up with the comics and movies set in the Marvel universe, Marvel Rivals presents the ultimate throwback to their childhood. In this new Hero Shooter by NetEase Games, players can choose from an iconic roaster of more than 30 Marvel heroes and utilize the team-up powers between them to seize victory.

But it takes more than just mastering your abilities and honing your skills to truly excel at the game. Without optimizing your graphical options, you'll be playing at a massive disadvantage against your opponents. Thankfully, Marvel Rivals gives you plenty of options to tweak the graphics in the game to squeeze out the best performance from your hardware.

Recommended PC Setting for High FPS in Marvel Rivals

Marvel Rivals doesn't require players to own top-of-the-line hardware to get good performance. The game's system requirement is reasonable, with an RTX 2060 as the recommended graphics card. On top of that, the game offers several adjustment options to set the graphics to your liking. Whether you're after the highest visual fidelity or want to get the most FPS without any flashiness, you'll be able to experience the game the way you see fit.

Here's the setting we recommend to get the most FPS out of your hardware without sacrificing too much of the visuals.

Setting Type

Setting Name

Recommended Option

Note

Display

Target Display

Primary Monitor

If you have multiple displays, this makes sure the game runs on your primary screen.

Display Mode

Fullscreen

This setting ensures your system dedicates the maximum resources to the game instead of background applications.

Aspect Ratio

Depends on your primary Display Monitor

-

Resolution

Depends on your primary Display Monitor

-

Anti-Aliasing and Super Resolution Type

DLSS/Xess/FSR

Choose DLSS for Nvidia, Xess for Intel, and FSR for AMD graphics cards.

Super Resolution Mode

Quality

Offers a good balance of image clarity and performance.

Super Resolution Sharpening

70–80

Setting it at a higher value causes image distortion.

Frame Generation Mode

Off

Turning it on increases input lag.

Low Latency Mode

Nvidia Reflex Low Latency.

Reduces input lag and increases responsiveness. Requires an Nvidia graphics card.

Brightness

50

Has no impact on performance. Adjust according to taste.

Limit FPS

Off

-

V-Sync

Off

-

Graphics

Graphics Quality

Custom

-

Global Illumination

SSGI - Low Quality

Adjusts Global Illumination. Higher settings offer better lighting, but the performance cost is high. We recommend setting it low for best performance.

Reflection Quality

Screen Space Reflection

Affects the quality of reflections. Screen Space Reflection has low performance hit.

Model Detail

High

Makes the hero models look more realistic. The performance impact is low when set to high.

Post-Processing

Low

Reduces the quality of in-game visual effects. High impact on performance.

Shadow Detail

Medium

Affects the quality of shadows. Medium offers realistic shadows without compromising performance.

Texture Detail

High

Higher setting increases the clarity of object textures in the game.

Effects Detail

Low

Enhances the quality of ability effects and scenes. Set it to low to avoid a massive performance hit.

Foliage Quality

Medium

Affects grass and other in-game foliage. Medium offers a good balance.

You can click on the Optimize button under Optimized Settings option to let the game choose the best graphical preset for you.

While our recommended PC settings can serve as a baseline, if you're playing on old hardware, adjust the options further to get the most in-game FPS. Refer to the notes we dropped beside each option while adjusting until you strike a good balance of visuals and performance in Marvel Rivals .

item.title: 10 Best SWAT Games
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Tactical shooters span a range of genres but typically emphasize teamwork, patience, and strategy.
  • Games like Ready Or Not and Ground Branch offer immersive special-forces-themed experiences.
  • Rainbow Six Siege and SWAT 4 provide competitive and classic tactical shooter gameplay, focusing on team dynamics.

Military themes are common and popular in almost all genres of games, but especially so when it comes to FPS games and tactical shooters. However, certain games like those in the Rainbow Six franchise and the SWAT series take on smaller-scale themes and environments by putting players in the shoes of a Special Forces unit, often giving them control over their squadmates.

The following games focus on intense combat, tactical decisions, strategy, an immersive atmosphere, and a slow pace that encourages teamwork, precision, and patience. Fans of the above should find something to enjoy here, be it a top-down tactical RTS game, or a nail-biting cooperative FPS that focuses on realism.

Updated on September 6, 2024, by Harry Ted Sprinks: There is an abundance of tactical shooters on the market, with Ready Or Not being one of the most popular in recent years. These games are often team-based, PvE shooters, though some games (such as Rainbow Six Siege) feature competitive online multiplayer. Despite this plethora of tactical shooters, it can be hard to discover games that theme themselves around SWAT and Special Forces. However, with Ready Or Not's popularity bringing tactical shooters back into the mainstream, there's never been a better time to enjoy tactical, SWAT-themed games.

10 Fast And Low

A Tactical VR Shooter With A Cartoon Tone

  • Platform: PC
  • Released: 2023
  • Developer: Urban Giraffe Games Inc.
  • Genre: Tactical Shooter

This tactical shooter features classic first-person shooter gameplay in a colorful cartoon world. Although Fast And Low retains the violence associated with the genre, the game includes an option to tone it down, even disabling character "gibbing."

Fast And Low is a VR game that can be played in local and online co-op. This is a rarity for VR games, and it's arguably better when played with a friend. Fast And Low takes heavy inspiration from classic SWAT and Rainbow Six titles, and despite its cartoon visuals, it remains a tactical experience.

9 Hot Brass

A Top-Down Shooter With A Unique Aesthetic

  • Platform: PC
  • Released: 2021
  • Developer: Walk With Kings
  • Genre: Top Down Shooter

This top-down shooter has a unique aesthetic that not everyone will love, but the way it displays characters as different icons makes the game highly readable. This is important in context, where players are frequently tasked with making split-second decisions.

Hot Brass is best played in the game's online or local co-op. Playing solo doesn't particularly feel like a SWAT experience, especially given that the player has no AI squadmates in single-player. Despite this, Hot Brass is a polished top-down shooter that offers a cheaper and more accessible experience than other SWAT-themed games.

8 Rainbow Six Siege

A Competitive Experience

There are several games in the Rainbow Six franchise that make for great SWAT experiences. While Rainbow Six Siege is arguably not the best game in the franchise, it provides a visceral online experience that's great for fans of competitive shooters.

Rainbow Six Siege is a tactical shooter that puts players in the shoes of one of several operators. The attacking and defending teams are asymmetric, with each operator having their own unique strengths and weaknesses. Teamwork is a massive part of Rainbow Six Siege , and it is integral to player success. As a result, the game is arguably much more fun when played with friends.

7 Ground Branch

Immersive And Highly Tactical

  • Platform: PC
  • Released: 2018
  • Developer: BlackFoot Studios
  • Genre: Tactical Shooter

Despite being in Early Access at the time of writing, Ground Branch is already a solid tactical shooter. The game prides itself on its immersive, highly tactical gameplay. As a result, it's great for fans of hardcore shooters.

One of the main draws of Ground Branch is its deep customization systems. In the game, players can customize their character and the equipment they carry with extreme detail, which dramatically impacts how they play. Combined with smooth and intuitive weapon handling, Ground Branch offers a well-crafted special-forces-themed tactical experience that's perfect for hardcore FPS fans.

6 Zero Hour

A Slow-Burning Tactical Shooter

  • Platform: PC
  • Released: 2020
  • Developer: M7 Productions, Attrito
  • Genre: Tactical Shooter

This tactical FPS game focuses on slow-paced gameplay and intense situations that work to put the player on the edge of their seat. The game has players defusing bombs, rescuing hostages, and generally dealing with bad guys in squads of up to 10 players in online co-op, though the game also allows for single-player with up to 9 AI squadmates.

Zero Hour features a planning table that allows players to plot out their operation before going in, as well as detailed and immersive gunplay. The game currently offers 15 distinct maps to play through.

5 No Plan B

A Tactical Strategy Game All About Planning

  • Platform: PC
  • Released: 2024
  • Developer: GFX47
  • Genre: Strategy

No Plan B 's gameplay revolves entirely around strategic planning. Once players give their team the go-ahead, the action starts, and gamers lose control. While this leads to a lot of trial-and-error gameplay, watching the team enact a well-crafted plan to perfection provides a satisfying feeling that never gets old.

No Plan B uses a timeline system that allows players to plan out and synchronize the movement and actions of their squad members, carefully positioning and ordering them at specific intervals. This focus on planning may turn certain players away, but for fans of strategic thinking, No Plan B is a rewarding experience.

4 Door Kickers

A Real-Time Tactics Game In Which Timing Is Everything

  • Platforms: PC, Nintendo Switch, Mobile
  • Released: 2014
  • Developer: KillHouse Games
  • Genre: Strategy

This top-down real-time tactics game has players controlling a SWAT team, leading them through several different building layouts using a series of triggered commands and real-time (with pause) strategy.

Choosing the right equipment and breach points is essential in Door Kickers , while precise timing and planning are crucial to pulling off a successful raid. Furthermore, almost all missions in Door Kickers play out in a matter of minutes, making it an easy game to pick up and play. Door Kickers also offers high replay value, complete with a level editor and two-player online co-op.

3 Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six 3: Raven Shield

A Slow-Paced, Tactical Classic

  • Platforms: PC, Mobile
  • Released: 2003
  • Developers: Ubi Soft Montreal, Ubi Soft Milan
  • Genre: Tactical Shooter

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six series has seen many iterations over the years, with Rainbow Six: Siege being one of the most popular competitive tactical shooters on the market. However, the original Rainbow Six games were very much focused on slower-paced tactical combat and squad commands that emphasized playing around the team and carefully planning. Every Rainbow Six fan has a favorite, but Rainbow Six 3 is arguably the best.

Before every mission in Rainbow Six 3 , players need to pick and customize their team members, all of which have different specialties and stats that distinguish them from the rest. Players will also need to carefully pick the loadout of each squad member, ensuring that they bring the right tools for the job. Rainbow Six 3 also gives players a planning phase before each mission, granting them access to the floor plan and allowing them to decide the starting positions of each squad. Players can also place waypoints for their squads and trigger specific actions (like throwing grenades), making Rainbow Six 3 extremely tactical even before the bullets start flying.

2 Ready Or Not

An Immersive, Tactical Shooter ThatIs Even Better With Friends

This intensely tactical and immersive FPS focuses on realism and teamwork that encourages a patient, slow-paced approach. The game takes heavy inspiration from the SWAT series but with more modernized graphics and a focus on multiplayer co-op. Ready Or Not is best played with friends, but the game does include customizable AI teammates that players can command in single-player.

Ready Or Not throws players into the deep end of a multitude of hostile scenarios, giving them a variety of tools to handle every situation. Managing every squad member's loadout is key to planning a successful operation, as players will need to make sure they're prepared for every situation. Dynamic, reactive enemies provide unpredictable opponents for players, and the erratic civilians add to the chaos and keep players second-guessing around every corner. Overall, Ready Or Not is a great experience for those who enjoy gritty, realism-heavy tactical shooters, especially if they have a regular group to play it with.

1 SWAT 4

The Pinnacle Of A Classic Franchise

As the fourth entry in what is arguably the greatest tactical shooter franchise (though Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six is certainly a contender), it could be argued that SWAT 4 is the pinnacle of the series, and perhaps one of - if not the - greatest SWAT games of all time.

SWAT 4 , developed by Irrational Games (the team behind System Shock 2 and BioShock Infinite , among others) and released in 2005, tasks players with moving through several missions packed with detailed, immersive environments. The gameplay is focused on quick reactions, following protocol, and taking advantage of squadmates using the game's intuitive controls. Furthermore, SWAT 4 features random hostage and enemy placement, making replaying missions a lot more intense than they otherwise would be, heavily improving the game's replay value.

item.title: 8 RPGs With The Best Dungeons, Ranked
item.description:
Most role-playing games whisk players on an adventure where they must encroach on hostile territory and take on several imposing foes as they head toward their goal. These dungeons may seem daunting at first glance, but players who decide to brave these dangers will be rewarded with everything from valuable loot to story progression.

Some of the best RPGs know how to craft engaging dungeons that are a blast to explore. A combination of fun mechanics, engaging encounters, memorable boss fights, and innovative design goes a long way in making these dungeon crawls more manageable, to the point where some players will actively relist the idea of exploring these dungeons and witnessing everything they have to offer.

8 Final Fantasy 15

Surprisingly Great Dungeons That Are A Lot Of Fun To Explore

Final Fantasy 15 has its fair share of issues, but one thing that most fans agree on is that the game's dungeons are a joy to explore. The flashy combat feels great in these enclosed spaces as long as the camera doesn't act up, and the mechanics in these hostile areas are innovative enough to keep fans engaged until the final hurdle.

Frequent party banter and bombastic boss fights go a long way in making these dungeons more engaging than ever before. While the recycled environments may dampen the experience somewhat, players will love signing on for a hunt as they make slow yet steady progress in these dungeons before reaching the end.

7 Pillars Of Eternity

The Endless Paths Of Od Nua Coupled With The Game's Many Dungeons Are Well-Made

A game that harkens back to the glory days of the CRPG genre, Pillars of Eternity is a great title to check out for players who want to enjoy some classic role-playing gameplay or familiarize themselves with the world that Avowed is set in. The Watcher of Caed Nua goes on several adventures where they explore their fair share of dungeons and take out the many enemies standing in his way.

It would be impossible to talk about the best dungeons in Pillars of Eternity without mentioning the Endless Paths of Od Nua. This multi-level dungeon is present under Caed Nua and compels players to explore the entire environment at their own pace, returning to tougher regions after getting stronger as they slowly uncover the mystery of this impossible structure.

6 Golden Sun

Abilities Can Be Used Outside Of Combat To Navigate Dungeons

Golden Sun is a beloved JRPG series that has remained dormant for way too long. It's a shame since the games boasted a unique approach where players assigned Djinns to set classes and acquire unique abilities that can be used either in battle or during exploration.

This means that dungeons can be quite dynamic and feature a focus on puzzles as players figure out the best way to navigate certain obstacles. With both exploration and combat being driven by player agency, it's easy to see why dungeons in Golden Sun become a great playground for players to test out their skills and make progress.

5 Arx Fatalis

The Entire Game Is One Interconnected Underground Dungeon

The underground city of Arx doubles as a massive dungeon where players slowly make progress, and it helps that the elements of immersive sim design coupled with a unique magic system help Arx Fatalis stand out as a unique RPG more fans should check out.

Players should be stocked and ready to take on tough enemies every time they leave a safe zone, exploring every nook and cranny to find valuables and secrets. It may be a hard game to get into, but a few hours are all it takes for players to adapt to the gameplay systems of Arx Fatalis and succeed in their goal to stop the God of Destruction from laying waste to this underground refuge.

4 Fallout: New Vegas

The Abandoned Vaults And Other Structures House Numerous Riveting Stories

The environmental design of Fallout: New Vegas is in a class of its own and goes a long way in making its "dungeons" feel amazing to traverse. Along with its amazing role-playing elements and stellar writing, what helps New Vegas feel so memorable is the magic of exploration that is rampant in this title.

It's not uncommon for players to stumble upon an abandoned settlement or Vault that is teeming with stories to uncover as players fight wave after wave of hostiles in these locations. The environmental storytelling and numerous options to make progress help New Vegas ' dungeons some of the very best the Fallout series has to offer.

3 Baldur's Gate 3

Features A Bunch Of Imaginative Dungeons With An Emphasis On Puzzles

One of the greatest role-playing games that needs no introduction, Baldur's Gate 3 is loaded with numerous dungeons that are daunting yet engaging to explore. The best part about any game made by Larian Studios is an immersive sim-esque approach to the gameplay, giving players numerous opportunities to tackle the challenges thrown their way in these dungeons.

This means that players who know what they're doing can game the system and trivialize a lot of the challenges in these dungeons, rewarding their creativity with easier solutions. Even if players don't stray from the beaten path, these dungeons feature interesting mechanics that make progression quite satisfying.

2 Dark Souls

The Interconnected World Helps Dungeon Exploration Feel More Rewarding Than Ever

Dark Souls is a game that became a phenomenon courtesy of its hard-as-nails combat and amazing environmental design that fans adore. The magic of exploration is prevalent in a title where exploration feels magical, which is why players enjoy making progress across its many areas.

The entirety of Dark Souls can be considered as one large interconnected dungeon that boasts some impressive verticality. Beating the area boss and making slow yet steady progress is extremely rewarding and helps Dark Souls stand strong as one of the greatest action RPGs ever made.

1 Persona 5 Royal

The Mind Palaces Are Unique And A Huge Improvement From Dungeons In Previous Persona Games

Persona 3 & 4 are some of the greatest JRPGs ever made, but there was one area that fans constantly complained about. The randomly generated dungeons that players had to get through could be rather repetitive after a point, becoming a chore in some instances.

This is why Persona 5 felt like a love letter to fans, addressing these complaints by hand-crafting every Mind Palace to feel more unique than ever before. These Palaces feature unique sections with fun gameplay switch-ups to keep exploration fresh and engaging for every Mind Palace in the game.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Showcases Pyro Traveler Team
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Pyro Traveler in Genshin Impact will be a powerful hypercarry with unique abilities and Pyro infusion at C6.
  • Recent beta footage leaked and showcases the Pyro Traveler's rotation but lacks equipped Artifacts for more accurate damage numbers.
  • Obtaining Pyro Traveler at C6 will be essential for a hypercarry role, and even with the potential for stronger 5-Star characters, the Pyro Traveler looks promising nonetheless.

Recent video footage from the Genshin Impact beta has provided players with a showcase of how powerful the Pyro Traveler can be on certain Vaporize teams. While Mavuika and Citlali are undoubtedly the stars of Version 5.3, the Pyro Traveler has been a popular topic in the Genshin Impact community as well. As opposed to previous ability kits, Natlan will only allow the Traveler to infuse themselves with Pyro in the final Act of its Archon Quest. This anticipation has produced no small amount of hype, which may be impossible for Version 5.3 to meet.

The Pyro Traveler in Genshin Impact has been described as a Pyro Xingqiu, but this comparison should only be taken at a surface level. The highlights of the ability kit lie in being able to consistently apply Pyro damage off-field, restore Nightsoul points to Natlan characters, and having Pyro infusion at C6. The latter opens up the possibility of using the Pyro Traveler as a hypercarry, but the question remains if the numbers are there.

Thanks to footage provided by Uncle Balls, an emerging star in the Genshin Impact Leaks community, players can finally form a good impression on the Pyro Traveler's value as a hypercarry. The video shows the Pyro Traveler going through their rotation against a Ruin Scout. In terms of party composition, Furina and Bennett join the Pyro Traveler to form a powerful core for their Vaporize team. The final party member is Xilonen, one of the best Support characters in Genshin Impact .

Genshin Impact: Is the Pyro Traveler Worth It?

It should be noted that while the damage numbers in the footage seem paltry, this Pyro Traveler doesn't have any Artifacts equipped. Given that Artifacts in Genshin Impact tend to be a major source of power, the Pyro Traveler's damage should be significantly higher under normal circumstances. However, the true value of the footage lies in how smooth the team rotation is, especially after the recent build reduced the cooldown of the Pyro Traveler's Elemental Skill by 2 seconds. With the Obsidian Codex set and a proper weapon, the Pyro Traveler could theoretically be able to trigger Vaporize hits higher than 300,000 via their Elemental Burst.

Getting the Pyro Traveler to C6 would be a must-have for anyone wishing to use them in a hypercarry role. While 5-Star characters in Genshin Impact such as Mavuika and Arlecchino will no doubt be better in the same Vaporize team, the overall consensus is leaning positive for the Pyro Traveler. Version 5.3 is expected to launch on January 1, 2025.
